004package kut;
005
006import java.util.ArrayList;
007import java.util.Date;
008import java.util.Calendar;
009import java.util.GregorianCalendar;
010import java.text.DateFormat;
011
012/**
013 * Manangement of dates and time. <p>
014 * 'time' is respresented by milliseconds, since the epoch
015 * (1970-01-01T00:00:00Z)
016 * NOTE:<p>
017 * Time values roll in functions fromXXX and mk. For example:<pre>
018 *    Time.eqDay(Time.fromStr("20020534"), Time.fromStr("20020603")) -> 'true'
019 *    Time.eqDay(Time.mk(34, 5, 2002), Time.mk(3, 6, 2002)) -> 'true'
020 * </pre>
021 */
022public class Time {
023  Time (){}
024
025  /**
026   * Returns a new Time adding tm + days.<p>
027   * NOTE: For add milliseconds use directly 'tm + days" (Example: 'tm + 234').
028   * @param tm Time
029   * @param days Days to add (It can be a negative number).
030   * @return A new time.
031   */
032  public static long addDays (long tm, int days) {
033    return tm + days * 86400000;
034  }
035
036  /**
037   * Returns tm day.
038   * @param tm Time.
039   * @return Value between 1 and end of month (both inclusive).
040   */
041  public static int day (long tm) {
042    GregorianCalendar c = new GregorianCalendar();
043    c.setTimeInMillis(tm);
044    return c.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH);
045  }
046
047  /**
048   * Returns difference in days between 'tm1' and 'tm2'.
049   * @param tm1 Time.
050   * @param tm2 Time.
051   * @return Difference in days.
052   */
053  public static int dfDays (long tm1, long tm2) {
054    return (int)((tm1 / 86400000) - (tm2 / 86400000));
055  }
056
057  /**
058   * Returns 'true' if tm1 and tm2 are in the same day.
059   * @param tm1 Time.
060   * @param tm2 Time.
061   * @return 'true' if tm1 and tm2 are in the same day.
062   */
063  public static boolean eqDay (long tm1, long tm2) {
064    return dfDays(tm1, tm2) == 0;
065  }
066
067  static String fmt2 (int n) {
068    String r = String.valueOf(n);
069    return r.length() > 1 ? r : "0" + r;
070  }
071
072  /**
073   * Returns a string representation of 'tm'.
074   * Template uses the folowing variables to do substitution:<pre>
075   *   %d  Day in number 06 -> 6.
076   *   %D  Day with two digits 06 -> 06.
077   *   %m  Month in number 03 -> 3.
078   *   %M  Month with two digits 03 -> 03.
079   *   %y  Year with two digits 2010 -> 10.
080   *   %Y  Year with four digits 2010 -> 2010.
081   *   %t  Time without milliseconds -> 15:03:55.
082   *   %T  Time with milliseconds -> 15:03:55.345.
083   *   %%  The sign '%'.
084   * </pre>
085   * @param template Template.
086   * @param tm Time.
087   * @return String.
088   */
089  public static String fmt (long tm, String template) {
090    GregorianCalendar c = new GregorianCalendar();
091    c.setTimeInMillis(tm);
092    return template
093      .replace("%d", String.valueOf(c.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH)))
094      .replace("%D", fmt2(c.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_MONTH)))
095      .replace("%m", String.valueOf(c.get(Calendar.MONTH) + 1))
096      .replace("%M", fmt2(c.get(Calendar.MONTH) + 1))
097      .replace("%y", fmt2(c.get(Calendar.YEAR) - 2000))
098      .replace("%Y", String.valueOf(c.get(Calendar.YEAR)))
099      .replace("%t", fmt2(c.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY)) + ":" +
100                     fmt2(c.get(Calendar.MINUTE)) + ":" +
101                     fmt2(c.get(Calendar.SECOND)))
102      .replace("%T", fmt2(c.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY)) + ":" +
103                     fmt2(c.get(Calendar.MINUTE)) + ":" +
104                     fmt2(c.get(Calendar.SECOND)) + "," +
105                     c.get(Calendar.MILLISECOND))
106      .replace("%%", "%")
107    ;
108  }
109
110  /**
111   * Returns a time from its date representation.
112   * @param date Date representation.
113   * @param sep Separator used by 'date'.
114   * @return Time.
115   */
116  public static Opt<Long> fromEn (String date, String sep) {
117    String[] ps = date.split(sep);
118    if (ps.length != 3) return Opt.none();
119    return fromStr(ps[2] + ps[0] + ps[1]);
120  }
121
122  /**
123   * Returns a time from its date representation. Equals to 'fromEn(date, "-")'.
124   * @param date Date representation.
125   * @return Time.
126   */
127  public static Opt<Long> fromEn (String date) {
128    return fromEn(date, "-");
129  }
130
131  /**
132   * Returns a time from its date representation.
133   * @param date Date representation.
134   * @param sep Separator used by 'date'.
135   * @return Time.
136   */
137  public static Opt<Long> fromIso (String date, String sep) {
138    String[] ps = date.split(sep);
139    if (ps.length != 3) return Opt.none();
140    return fromStr(ps[2] + ps[1] + ps[0]);
141  }
142
143  /**
144   * Returns a time from its date representation. Equals to 'fromIso(date, "-")'.
145   * @param date Date representation.
146   * @return Time.
147   */
148  public static Opt<Long> fromIso (String date) {
149    return fromIso(date, "/");
150  }
151
152  /**
153   * Returns a time from its date representation.
154   * @param date Date representation.
155   * @return Time.
156   */
157  public static Opt<Long> fromStr (String date) {
158    if (date.length() != 8 || !Mth.isDigits(date)) return Opt.none();
159    return Opt.some(mk(
160      Mth.stoi(date.substring(6)).getValue(),
161      Mth.stoi(date.substring(4, 6)).getValue(),
162      Mth.stoi(date.substring(0, 4)).getValue()
163    ));
164  }
165
166  /**
167   * Returns tm hour.
168   * @param tm Time.
169   * @return Value between 1 and 23 (both inclusive).
170   */
171  public static int hour (long tm) {
172    GregorianCalendar c = new GregorianCalendar();
173    c.setTimeInMillis(tm);
174    return c.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY);
175  }
176
177  /**
178   * Returns tm millisecond.
179   * @param tm Time.
180   * @return Value between 0 and 999 (both inclusive).
181   */
182  public static int millisecond (long tm) {
183    GregorianCalendar c = new GregorianCalendar();
184    c.setTimeInMillis(tm);
185    return c.get(Calendar.MILLISECOND);
186  }
187
188  /**
189   * Returns tm minute.
190   * @param tm Time.
191   * @return Value between 0 and 59 (both inclusive).
192   */
193  public static int minute (long tm) {
194    GregorianCalendar c = new GregorianCalendar();
195    c.setTimeInMillis(tm);
196    return c.get(Calendar.MINUTE);
197  }
198
199  /**
200   * Returns tm month.
201   * @param tm Time.
202   * @return Value between 1 and 12 (both inclusive).
203   */
204  public static int month (long tm) {
205    GregorianCalendar c = new GregorianCalendar();
206    c.setTimeInMillis(tm);
207    return c.get(Calendar.MONTH) + 1;
208  }
209
210  /**
211   * Returns the current time.
212   * @return Current time.
213   */
214  public static long now () {
215    GregorianCalendar c = new GregorianCalendar();
216    c.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, java.time.LocalTime.now().getHour());
217    return new GregorianCalendar().getTimeInMillis();
218  }
219
220  /**
221   * Returns a new time. Equals to 'mk(day, month, year, 12, 0, 0)'<br>
222   * @param day Day in base 1 (1 to 31).
223   * @param month Month in base 1 (1 to 12).
224   * @param year Year with four digits.
225   * @return Time.
226   */
227  public static long mk (int day, int month, int year) {
228    return mk(day, month, year, 12, 0, 0);
229  }
230
231  /**
232   * Returns a new time.
233   * @param day Day in base 1 (1 to 31).
234   * @param month Month in base 1 (1 to 12).
235   * @param year Year with four digits.
236   * @param hour (0 to 23)
237   * @param minute (0 to 59)
238   * @param second (0 to 59)
239   * @return Time.
240   */
241  public static long mk (
242    int day, int month, int year, int hour, int minute, int second
243  ) {
244    GregorianCalendar c = new GregorianCalendar();
245    c.set(year, month - 1, day, hour, minute, second);
246    return c.getTimeInMillis() / 1000 * 1000;
247  }
248
249  /**
250   * Returns tm second.
251   * @param tm Time.
252   * @return Value between 0 and 59 (both inclusive).
253   */
254  public static int second (long tm) {
255    GregorianCalendar c = new GregorianCalendar();
256    c.setTimeInMillis(tm);
257    return c.get(Calendar.SECOND);
258  }
259
260  /**
261   * Equals to 'fmt("%M-%D-%Y", tm)'
262   * @param tm Time.
263   * @return String.
264   */
265  public static String toEn (long tm) {
266    return fmt(tm, "%M-%D-%Y");
267  }
268
269  /**
270   * Equals to 'fmt("%D/%M/%Y", tm)'
271   * @param tm Time.
272   * @return String.
273   */
274  public static String toIso (long tm) {
275    return fmt(tm, "%D/%M/%Y");
276  }
277
278  /**
279   * Equals to 'fmt("%Y%M%D", tm)'
280   * @param tm Time.
281   * @return String.
282   */
283  public static String toStr (long tm) {
284    return fmt(tm, "%Y%M%D");
285  }
286
287  /**
288   * Returns tm weekday.
289   * @param tm Time.
290   * @return Value between 0(sunday) and 6(saturday) (both inclusive).
291   */
292  public static int weekday (long tm) {
293    GregorianCalendar c = new GregorianCalendar();
294    c.setTimeInMillis(tm);
295    return c.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_WEEK) - Calendar.SUNDAY;
296  }
297
298  /**
299   * Returns tm year.
300   * @param tm Time.
301   * @return Full year value.
302   */
303  public static int year (long tm) {
304    GregorianCalendar c = new GregorianCalendar();
305    c.setTimeInMillis(tm);
306    return c.get(Calendar.YEAR);
307  }
308
309  /**
310   * Returns tm year day.
311   * @param tm Time.
312   * @return Value between 1 and last year day (both inclusive).
313   */
314  public static int yearDay (long tm) {
315    GregorianCalendar c = new GregorianCalendar();
316    c.setTimeInMillis(tm);
317    return c.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_YEAR);
318  }
319}
